name: Cell Command
description: In Cell Command, students embark on a series of exciting missions aboard a microscopic "cell ship." At the outset, students operate a single station (e.g., the "ribosome station"), but eventually command all the ship's functions...

name: Crazy Plant Shop
description: In Crazy Plant Shop, students learn about genes and inheritance by breeding zany plants like the Chomplex (plants with big chompy teeth), Catcus (cactus cats), and Bunnyon (onion bunnies)! Special order requests from mysterious...

name: You Make Me Sick!
description: In You Make Me Sick, students take on the role of a pathogen and custom design their disease to infiltrate a variety of unique target hosts. As they progress, they must improve their infectious properties in order to infect hosts...

name: Citizen Science
description: Citizen Science is an adventure game that teaches scientific literacy and limnology. Funded by the National Science Foundation, the game is being developed in partnership with University of Wisconsin - Madison Assistant Professor...

name: Counties Work
description: In this game, the player will take on the responsibility of managing a County's resources. They will plan new developments for zoning and building, determine new transportation projects, and help citizens in their county match...

name: People's Pie
description: In People's Pie, you take the helm of America's Federal Budget which is represented as a huge pie...and everyone wants a piece!  Different government agencies propose different services, and you must balance the citizen's...

name: Superkids
description: Superkids Reading Program is a core reading program designed for Kindergarten through Grade 2 that looks like no other and works like no other, with a cast of characters that children love. Based on a proven pedagogy and...

name: Commander of the Nautilus
description: Explore the oceans of our world in this game. Ocean Explorer Katy Croff Bell will be your guide as you travel the globe. Test research equipment off the coast of Washington state. Study the hydrothermal vents of the Lost City...

name: iCivics.org
description: Alongside iCivics, Filament has developed a new portal for civics education. In addition to showcasing some rad, free-to-play civics games, the iCivics website connects students with teachers (and even with  project visionary...

name: Immigration Nation
description: Do you know how people become citizens of the United States? In Immigration Nation, you'll find out as you guide newcomers along their path to citizenship. Good luck!

name: Responsibility Launcher
description: Have you ever wanted to knock some civic sense into someone? In Responsibility Launcher, you can ... You'll remind citizens that their civic duties aren't just responsibilities, they help get things done!

name: Activate
description: Activate demonstrates how social change happens because of motivated individuals. Volunteer for an issue that affects you by holding a bake sale or writing to Congress. Directly affect your community by helping out at the animal...

name: Oncology
description: In Oncology, the player operates a radiation therapy clinic, consulting with patients to decide on how best to treat them. After performing diagnostic contouring and treating patients with individualized radiation therapy, the...

name: Cast Your Vote
description: What issues do you want to ask candidates about? In Cast Your Vote, you choose the questions in a debate, rate the candidates' responses, and vote for the candidate of your choice.

name: Master Mines
description: Travel the world to discover and identify mineral specimens with Master Mines. You'll visit mining sites worldwide to gather specimens, then bring them back to the lab for analysis. Perform tests to determine hardness, cleavage,...

name: Represent Me!
description:
In Represent Me!, you work as a legislator trying to meet the needs of your constituents.
The people who voted you into office have various backgrounds, diverse opinions, and they each want different things from you....

name: Court Quest
description: In  Court Quest, you'll act as a guide to citizens seeking justice within the  United States court system. Listen to their stories and help them  navigate the road to justice! Guide as many as you can  through the court system...

name: Executive Command
description: Ever wondered how you'd do as President of the United States? Find out with Executive Command! Try your hand at juggling the challenges and responsibilities of a term in office. Can you accomplish anything related to your chosen...

name: Landform Detectives
description:
A violent volcanic explosion immediately and forever alters the landscape. Elsewhere, raindrops gradually pick patterns out of the rock over the course of thousands of years.
Can you recreate some of Earth's most amazing...

name: Branches of Power
description: Branches of Power lets you play all three branches of government, collectively charged with a critical goal: to build new laws! As President, choose issues you think are important and rally the people around them. As a legislator...

name: LawCraft
description: Are you ready to legislate? Play a Congressperson from the state and district of your choice in LawCraft. Your constituents will send you letters describing issues that concern them, and it's up to you to take them through...

name: Eco Defenders
description: With some help from JASON Host Researcher Russell Cuhel, size up one of three ecosystems before designing an invasive species to infiltrate and disrupt, eliminating rival species and witnessing the rippling repercussions your...

name: Argument Wars
description: Argument Wars is a game designed to highlight the role of argumentation and reasoning in civic engagement. Step into the shoes of a lawyer and participate in trials ripped straight out of the history books. In order to win points...

name: Energy City
description: Craft an urban energy portfolio that balances economic, social, and environmental issues...all while negotiating with stakeholders and generating enough power to support a growing population. Do you have what it takes to...

name: Transform It!
description: Ever wonder how energy gets from a heap of biomass to a streetlight? Then Transform It! is the game for you. Assemble contraptions out of components like furnaces, turbines, and generators in order to convert energy from a source...

name: Do I Have A Right?
description: Do I Have a Right? explores the Bill of Rights in the context of operating and growing a Constitutional law firm from obscure to distinguished status. Hire lawyers with special talents and areas of expertise and assign them to...

name: Resilient Planet: Flower Garden Banks
description: An offshore oil platform located in the Gulf of Mexico is scheduled to be dismantled via explosives. The local marine life, including two endangered sea turtle species (hawksbills and leatherbacks), is vulnerable to damage and...

name: Resilient Planet: NW Hawaiian Islands
description: A supposed shark infestation threatens to harm a near pristine ocean ecosystem in the NW Hawaiian Islands and, in particular, a population of critically endangered Hawaiian monk seals. In Mission 4 of Resilient Planet, players...

name: Coaster Creator
description: Ever wanted to build your own roller coaster? Of course you have! Coaster Creator is a design-based exploration of energy transfer and the concepts of potential and kinetic energy. Step into the role of a roller coaster engineer...

name: Cosmos Chaos
description: Cosmos Chaos is a Nintendo DS title designed to improve reading proficiency and vocabulary acquisition among 4th grade students, a demographic known to grapple with the transition from “learning to read” to “reading to learn”....
